title: Cryptologic Spanish Linguist
description: Part of a joint team of military members and contractors responsible for conducting SIGINT operations (collection and analysis), SIGINT research-target development, High Frequency Direction Finding (HFDF), Geo-location and population of DoD databases against targets of interest in direct support of USSOUTHCOM, USARSOUTH Conducts daily live Counter Terrorism (CT) and Counter Narcotics (CN) missions and prosecutes HVTs providing intelligence production, collection and force protection Expert HFDF operator, and geospatial analyst Responsible for training a joint team of military personnel and contractors in SIGINT collection and production in a remote operational facility. Use ArcGis, and Google Earth to provide geolocation
name: Andrew Bench

groups.name: Intel, Counterterrorism & Security: An Exclusive Group for Military, LE & Security Pros
TRANSLATORS, INTERPRETERS, LINGUISTS, LINGUISTIC MEDIATORS AND LANGUAGE PROFESSIONALS
All-Source, Intelligence, Counterintelligence, Counterterrorist Professional Network

summary: TS/SCI Clearance Full Scope Polygraph Spanish ILR score of 3+/3+/4 B.A. History Career Profile ￼ Eight years of experience in special operations.  Six years experience as a US Army Ranger in the 75th Ranger Regiment analyzing IMINT, HUMINT and SIGINT and integration of ISR to build targeting packages and produce intelligence products to action time sensitive and high value targets in the CJSOTF targeting line of operations (counterinsurgency and counter IED). 3 deployments to OEF and 3 deployments to OIF all in direct support of CJSOTF.  Full knowledge of intelligence cycle, collection management cycle, and geospatial analysis and the integration of ISR to plan and conduct direct action missions, special reconnaissance, and sensitive site exploitation and clandestine insertions . Two years experience as a SOT-A team member providing organic intelligence and electronic warfare support to U.S. Army Special Forces Operational Detachment-Alpha teams through intercepting foreign voice communications, processing raw SIGINT data to plan and conduct unconventional warfare and foreign internal defense missions. One year as a CAT III Spanish linguist supporting counter terrorism operations in the USSOUTHCOM AOR through raw IMINT and SIGINT collection and analysis and geo spatial analysis.

title: SOT-A Team Sergeant
name: Andrew Bench

title: US Army Ranger
description: Plan and conduct special operations as a member of the 75th Ranger Regiment as part of CJSOTF.  Analyze HUMINT, IMINT, and SIGINT and integreate ISR into the intelligence cycle to carry out counterterrorism operations against high value targets during three deployments to OIF and three deployments to OEF. Expert at using ISR and the intelligence cycle to provide pattern of life, SIGINT and HUMINT intelligence corroboration to plan and action direct action missions, clandestine insertions, and special reconnaissance Use of full motion video and Falcon View in mission planning and execution Conduct sensitive site exploitation, and biometric analysis as a member of a CJSOTF assault force on a daily basis while deployed Analyzing integrated intelligence products from various special operation units and federal agencies to develop targeting packages of high value targets As Team Leader led a 4 man Ranger team on over 400 direct action raids
name: Andrew Bench

title: Deputy Chief, Cryptologic Services Group
description: Provides tailored, real-time intelligence support to the operations center of the National Counterterrorism Center. Ensures timely distribution of SIGINT reporting, to include limited distribution reports; provides customer feedback to the home agency on relevance and utility of reporting; assists with requests for information from NSA on sensitive topics of interest to the customer. • Created a new distribution system for limited-distribution reports of interest to NCTC principals. Impact: Ensured that only principals with a genuine need-to-know received the reports in a timely manner. • Prepared the first comprehensive PowerPoint briefing on the collection, processing, and reporting of SIGINT critical to the functioning of the operations center. Impact: Helped new operations center analysts to better understand SIGINT and its role in all-source reporting.
name: Gerson Kuhr
summary: An intelligence professional with over 34 years of experience in all facets of Signals Intelligence (SIGINT), to include collection, analysis, and reporting, with increasing responsibilities in managing people. Extensive experience in liaison work with, and SIGINT support to, the Central Intelligence Agency, the Defense Intelligence Agency, and the Office of the Director for National Intelligence. Proficient with ANCHORY retrieval techniques. SECURITY CLEARANCE: CURRENT TS//SI//TK WITH FULL-SCOPE POLYGRAPH AND SPECIAL ACCESSES

title: Watch Officer, Cryptologic Services Group
description: Responsible for identifying opportunities to integrate SIGINT reporting into the operations center’s mission of alerting agency principals to fused, time-sensitive intelligence; selecting reporting that warrants the immediate attention of the President’s briefers and the National Intelligence Council; responding to questions on SIGINT and its capabilities. • Oversaw a major augmentation of a data base housing sensitive, limited-distribution reports. Impact: Closed critical information gaps which allowed all-source analysts to develop a more complete picture of certain high-profile intelligence operations. • Refined a method by which critical bits of information were manually inputted into an agency-wide tool as a counter-method to inputting the material via the automated option. Impact: This refined method allowed other members of the team to continue inputting information into the tool when the automated option was not functioning, which occurred frequently following system upgrades.
name: Gerson Kuhr
summary: An intelligence professional with over 34 years of experience in all facets of Signals Intelligence (SIGINT), to include collection, analysis, and reporting, with increasing responsibilities in managing people. Extensive experience in liaison work with, and SIGINT support to, the Central Intelligence Agency, the Defense Intelligence Agency, and the Office of the Director for National Intelligence. Proficient with ANCHORY retrieval techniques. SECURITY CLEARANCE: CURRENT TS//SI//TK WITH FULL-SCOPE POLYGRAPH AND SPECIAL ACCESSES

title: Senior Watch Officer
description: Managed collection resources for airborne and global response collection conducted against worldwide targets in accordance with DoD tasking. Provided real-time operational management of remote collection sites, equipment, and data forwarding links with the authority to implement ad hoc tasking for up to 72 hours. • Devised a comprehensive program for quarterly SIGINT nuclear weapons support (SNS) training, and administered the training module to all operations center personnel. Impact: The training was instrumental in raising the operations center test scores by 8 points during the next scheduled test. • Developed a working aid to identify, in the primary operations center log shared by all four teams, the originators of a type of formatted tactical report supporting an ongoing military operation. Impact: The project was driven by a request from the chief of the operations center, and provided each team chief with a more comprehensive look at certain critical segments of the military operation. • Instituted a mandatory training program to keep members of my team conversant with reporting and handling procedures for time-sensitive reporting. Impact: The team later achieved the highest score among all four operations center teams.
name: Gerson Kuhr
summary: An intelligence professional with over 34 years of experience in all facets of Signals Intelligence (SIGINT), to include collection, analysis, and reporting, with increasing responsibilities in managing people. Extensive experience in liaison work with, and SIGINT support to, the Central Intelligence Agency, the Defense Intelligence Agency, and the Office of the Director for National Intelligence. Proficient with ANCHORY retrieval techniques. SECURITY CLEARANCE: CURRENT TS//SI//TK WITH FULL-SCOPE POLYGRAPH AND SPECIAL ACCESSES

title: Special Assistant for Crisis Management
description: Served as the focal point for reporting policy and dissemination during crises. Represented the directorate chief at Crisis Management Steering Group and Intelligence Community meetings, and in dealings with the Special Representative to DCI for Intelligence Disclosure. • Developed new procedures for providing extended SIGINT support to the Commanding General of an international peace keeping force. Impact: Such support improved both force protection and strategic planning. • Drafted and implemented innovative guidance which allowed for direct, real-time geolocational support to the government of a U.S. ally during two separate operations to rescue hostages held by an international terrorist group. Impact: The guidance improved coordination among collection operations, NSA liaison, and customer groups. • Oversaw the development of the Local Support Report for the Customer Response Directorate, a new reporting vehicle designed to document support for selected collection sites. Impact: The vehicle provided the first tailored reporting for collection site customers.
name: Gerson Kuhr
summary: An intelligence professional with over 34 years of experience in all facets of Signals Intelligence (SIGINT), to include collection, analysis, and reporting, with increasing responsibilities in managing people. Extensive experience in liaison work with, and SIGINT support to, the Central Intelligence Agency, the Defense Intelligence Agency, and the Office of the Director for National Intelligence. Proficient with ANCHORY retrieval techniques. SECURITY CLEARANCE: CURRENT TS//SI//TK WITH FULL-SCOPE POLYGRAPH AND SPECIAL ACCESSES

title: Team Chief, Cryptologic Services Group
description: Supervised military analysts who provided real-time interpretation, advice, and assistance in SIGINT to the NMJIC Deputy Director for Intelligence (DDI) and, ultimately, the J2. The team prepared a daily summary of significant SIGINT products gleaned from NSA and field reporting which was sent to members of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, military services intelligence chiefs, and senior policy makers at the Pentagon. Provided technical guidance on intelligence reporting and classification issues for NMCC analytic desks, and oversaw distribution of SIGINT products to J2 target analysts. • Developed plans to standardize training for incoming team chiefs and the procedure for producing the daily summary of significant SIGINT products. Impact: Allowed the active duty military analysts to work effectively while substituting on different teams (a frequent practice with personal leave and required military training) and ensured the customer a high-quality intelligence summary regardless of the team producing it. • Initiated a new procedure for disseminating to the NMJIC DDI and Deputy Director for Operations, J3, time-sensitive intelligence information from the products of foreign intelligence partners. Impact: Made critical information from Second and Third Parties available to Department of Defense principals on a more-timely basis.
name: Gerson Kuhr
summary: An intelligence professional with over 34 years of experience in all facets of Signals Intelligence (SIGINT), to include collection, analysis, and reporting, with increasing responsibilities in managing people. title: Underground Facility Manager
description: Responsible for the maintenance, operation and access to underground SCIF facility and associated equipment located at Fort Hood. Assistance Security Specialist for 780th MI Bde.
name: Michael Grand

title: First Sergeant
description: Supervisory leadership for 34 personnel in a HQs Company providing administrative, financial, legal, logistics, training and operation support to a joint-service forward deployed Department of Defense installation supporting National Security Agency (NSA) operations at 2 UK remote sites. Manage intelligence production requirements, intelligence processes, and resources. Promulgate policy for production database programs.
name: Michael Grand

title: First Sergeant
description: First Sergeant for a tactical MI company. Deployed 114 Soldiers in support of Operation New Dawn. Provided HUMINT, SIGINT, UAS, IMAGERY and All-Source intelligence in support of the 2nd Brigade, 1 Cavalry Division. My soldiers were responsible for the security and turn over of 5 bases during U.S. Forces withdraw from Iraq Led train-up, searches, evidence collection, and interviews to support identification, investigation, and conviction of soldiers engaged in illegal activities.  Coordinated movement operations, site set-up, logistics, intelligence quality control, redeployment and recovery operations during multiple field operations.  Led 278 personnel deploying to multiple destinations in Iraq. Accountable for personnel and sensitive items including weapons and Top Secret media during 7-day travel through 4 countries.
name: Michael Grand

title: SIGINT Liasion/Antiterrorism Officer
description: Managed the unit antiterrorism measures program, and SIGINT liaison between NSA and Multi-National forces in Bagdad. Performed long-range planning for gathering, analyzing and exploiting intelligence. Focused intelligence efforts to geo-locate high value targets and to support the counter-IED mission.  Assigned to the National Security Agency, Georgia, as the Signal Intelligence Liaison between the NSA site and 1st Calvary Multi-National Division in Iraq. Leveraged NSA capabilities to support combat and force protection operations for the division.  Managed and coordinated Random Anti-Terrorism Measures to protect and reduce risks for personnel and facilities. Conducted risk and vulnerability assessments to deter terrorist incidents, employ countermeasures, and mitigate and recover from a terrorist incident.  Member of the Fort Hood Installation force protection working group. Conducted threat assessments of installation facilities. Staffed special event planning matrixes with Force Protection Office personnel to ensure safety of ceremonies considered possible targets for terrorist activities.  Trained personnel on Anti-terrorism Level I protective measures.
name: Michael Grand

title: Military Intelligence Detachment NCOIC
description: Deployed to various countries to manage intelligence collection teams. Developed intelligence production procedures, requirements, and strategies. Scripted and executed a statistically based assessment that evaluated intelligence analysis procedures for efficiencies.  Deployed to Colombia: Led a SOT-A team to various locations supporting Special Operation Detachment Alphas (ODA) conducting forensic evaluations of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) locations searching for proof of life on U.S. captives.  Cleared quarters used by U.S. diplomats to ensure no electronic listening devices were present.  Led team in conducting intelligence collection as a force protection measure supporting the U.S. Embassy in Bogota. As the only Spanish speaking jumpmaster, led a Colombian military airborne operation.  Signal Intelligence Section Manager during the unit’s 2007 deployment to Afghanistan. Managed 4 SOT-A teams assigned to ODA teams in several Southern Provinces. Directed the production of Signal Collection intelligence predictive analysis to determine enemy probable courses of action and to identify high interest targets for surgical tactical Special Forces operations.  Led a 46-member Military Intelligence Detachment providing all Human, Signals, All-Source and Imagery Intelligence collection, analysis and production for Special Forces Operations in Southern Afghanistan during 2008 deployment.  Managed the Special Operation Task Force’s Interpreter program. Procured $2.4M in funding to provide U.S. and foreign national interpreters for ODA, SOT-A and SOT-B teams. Conducted interviews and approved hiring, firing and payrolls for 170 CAT I, II and III linguists.  Facilities director for Special Forces compound. Directed maintenance, construction, safety and defensive plans for compound housing over 400 military and civilian personnel. Assigned sectors of defense, guard details, and housing. Controlled supply depot and logistics.
name: Michael Grand

title: All-Source Master Analyst
description: Led all SIGINT operations and training. Configured and coordinated secure satellite communications equipment. Developed intelligence plans, managed and coordinated a variety of intelligence actions and programs; intelligence analysis and production, intelligence collection and operations. Maintained $7M in intelligence and communications equipment. Managed operational funds.  Trained as an All-Source Master Analyst and designated as the only Master Analyst in the division.  Authored tactics, techniques and procedures for the 82nd Airborne Analysis and Control Element (ACE), resulting in 82nd ABN DIV having the most accurate intelligence database of all 18th ABN Corp units.  All-Source Master Analyst, Afghanistan, (6/2002 – 2/2003): After 9-11, formed an analysis team for the division’s first deployment to Afghanistan. Directed construction of an intelligence facility and emplacement of satellite communications equipment. Managed setup, and configuration of intelligence architecture.  Collection and Jamming (C&J) Platoon Sergeant, Iraq, (2/2003 – 8/2005): Led an electronic warfare C&J platoon utilizing Prophet mobile collection systems during the 2003 Iraq invasion.  Served as construction safety liaison to ensure Iraqi contractors built facilities to U.S. code.  Jumpmaster for military airborne operations. Led airborne operations supervising the activities of jumpmaster teams, multiple aircraft, ground crews and hundreds of paratroopers.
name: Michael Grand
